At-a-Glance: Stonebrood is a fungal disease caused by Aspergillus that mummifies brood.
Why it Matters: Rare but zoonotic risk to beekeepers.
Can weaken colonies and contaminate combs.
Step-by-Step: 1) Confirm diagnosis via lab if suspected.
3) Disinfect equipment and maintain hive hygiene.
Safety & Compliance: Wear PPE when handling suspected cases to avoid spore inhalation.
